dmca.title: [EV1-C2237601N] Illegal Linking & Theft of Code
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Abuse@ev1servers.net [mailto:Abuse@ev1servers.net] 
Sent: Saturday, December 23, 2006 9:40 PM
To: DMCA
Subject: [EV1-C2237601N] Illegal Linking & Theft of Code

==== Forwarded Ticket ====

helo=PALSYS) 
        by server1.palsys.ca with esmtpa (Exim 4.52) 
        id 1GxiL1-0006XE-KJ 
        for abuse@ev1servers.net; Fri, 22 Dec 2006 05:13:20 -0600
From: "PalSys Network - Administration" <admin@palsys.ca>
To: <abuse@ev1servers.net>
X-ASG-Orig-Subj: Illegal Linking & Theft of Code
Subject: Illegal Linking & Theft of Code
Date: Fri, 22 Dec 2006 03:13:19 -0800
MIME-Version: 1.0

        boundary="----=_NextPart_000_0008_01C72577.239AC530"

with any abuse report

X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of
TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 WHITELISTED
Return-Path: admin@palsys.ca
X-OriginalArrivalTime: 22 Dec 2006 11:13:34.0700 (UTC)
FILETIME=[389852C0:01C725BA] 

 (multipart/alternative)
Multipart prefix (text/plain)
This is a multi-part message in MIME format. 
 
MIME element (text/plain)
Hello, 
 
  
 
  It has come to our attention that a site hosted on your network,
http://www.xmpchat.com, is illegally using our code and has gone so far
as 
to hotlink images as well.    The network bar shown at the top of this
site 
has been stolen from our company site at http://www.palsys.ca
<http://www.palsys.ca/> .  This user is currently serving the background
image on the bar from our server. 
 
  
 
  Please have our entire code removed from this site and be sure that
our 
bandwidth is no longer being stolen as soon as possible. 
 
  
 
Thank you, 
 
  
 
Chris Redman 
 
Paladin Systems
